trans-unit.source: A factory that creates channels of different types that are used by clients to send messages to variously configured service endpoints.
This generic class enables more advanced scenarios where there is a requirement to create a channel factory that can be used to create more than one type of channel.
When adding behaviors programmatically, the behavior is added to the appropriate `Behaviors` property on the <xref:System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory> prior to the creation of any channel.
See the example section for a code sample.
Frequently client or calling applications (for example, middle-tier applications are client applications, too) using this type also have complex state management needs as well as performance needs.
For more information about these scenarios, please see [Middle-Tier Client Applications](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/middle-tier-client-applications.md).
The type of channel produced by the channel factory.
This type must be either <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IOutputChannel"></xref> or <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.IRequestChannel"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory`1"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory`1"></xref> class.
Use this constructor when you want to pass the binding information programmatically rather than using an application configuration file.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding"></xref> specified for the channels produced by the factory.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory`1"></xref> class that produces channels with a specified endpoint.
Use this constructor when you want to pass the service endpoint information programmatically rather than using an application configuration file.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint"></xref> for the channels produced by the factory.
The endpoint is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory`1"></xref> class with a specified endpoint configuration name.
Use this constructor when there is more than one target endpoint in the application configuration file.
The configuration name used for the endpoint.
endpointConfigurationName is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory`1"></xref> class.
Use this constructor when you want to pass the channel type information programmatically rather than using an application configuration file.
The `channelType` parameter must be an interface.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of channel produced by the factory.
The channelType is `null`.
The channelType is a class or value type and is not an interface.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory`1"></xref> class with a specified binding and endpoint address.
Use this constructor when you want to pass the binding and address information programmatically rather than using an application configuration file.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding"></xref> used to configure the endpoint.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> that provides the location of the service.
The binding is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory`1"></xref> class with a specified binding and remote address.
Use this constructor when you want to pass the information about the remote address information with a string rather than as a typed object.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding"></xref> used to configure the endpoint.
The address that provides the location of the service.
remoteAddress is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory`1"></xref> class associated with a specified name for the endpoint configuration and remote address.
The configuration name used for the endpoint.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> that provides the location of the service.
endpointConfigurationName or remoteAddress is `null`.
Creates a channel of a specified type that is used to send messages to a service endpoint at a specified transport address that is configured with a specified binding.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding"></xref> used to configure the endpoint.
The <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> that contains the transport address to which the channel sends messages.
The TChannel of type created by the factory.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory"></xref> has duplex operations it does not support.
Creates a channel that is used to send messages to a service at a specific endpoint address through a specified transport address.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> that provides the location of the service.
The <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> that contains the transport address to which the channel sends messages.
The TChannel of type created by the factory.
is `null`.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory"></xref> has duplex operations it does not support.
Creates a channel of a specified type that is used to send messages to a service endpoint that is configured with a specified binding.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Channels.Binding"></xref> used to configure the endpoint.
The TChannel of type created by the factory.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory"></xref> has duplex operations it does not support.
Creates a channel that is used to send messages to a service at a specific endpoint address.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.EndpointAddress"></xref> that provides the location of the service.
The TChannel of type created by the factory.
is `null`.
Creates a channel of a specified type to a specified endpoint address.
Creates a channel of type `TChannel`, the generic parameter for the class.
The TChannel of type created by the factory.
Creates a channel that is used to send messages to a service whose endpoint is configured in a specified way.
The name of the endpoint configuration used for the service.
The TChannel of type created by the factory.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.ChannelFactory"></xref> has duplex operations it does not support.
Creates a channel that is used to send messages to a service with an act as security token.
The security token.
The created channel factory.
Creates a channel that is used to send messages to a service with an act as security token at a specific endpoint address.
The security token
The endpoint address that provides the location of the service.
The created channel factory.
Creates a channel that is used to send messages to a service with an act as security token at a specific endpoint address through a specified transport address.
The security token
The endpoint address that provides the location of the service.
The transport address to which the channel sends messages.
The created channel factory.
Creates a channel that is used to send messages to a service with an issued security token.
The issued security token.
The created channel factory.
Creates a channel that is used to send messages to a service with an issued security token at a specific endpoint address.
The issued security token.
The endpoint address that provides the location of the service.
The created channel factory.
Creates a channel that is used to send messages to a service with an issued security token at a specific endpoint address through a specified transport address.
The issued security token.
The endpoint address that provides the location of the service.
The transport address to which the channel sends messages.
The created channel factory.
Creates a channel that is used to send messages to a service with an on behalf of security token at a specific endpoint address through a specified transport address.
The security token.
The endpoint address that provides the location of the service.
The transport address to which the channel sends messages.
The created channel factory.
Creates a channel that is used to send messages to a service with an on behalf of security token.
The security token.
The created channel factory.
Creates a channel that is used to send messages to a service with an on behalf of security token at a specific endpoint address.
The security token.
The endpoint address that provides the location of the service.
The created channel factory.
Creates a description of the service endpoint.
The <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint"></xref> of the service.
The callback contract is `null` but the service endpoint requires one that is non-`null`.
